cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then northeast, weakening while moving inland across the Carolinas and reaching the Mid-Atlantic coast before moving offshore toward southern New England.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just north of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia and the Mid-Atlantic states up through southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Gusty northeast winds possible Monday with occasional gusts 25–35 mph; chance of sustained tropical-storm force winds only 6%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises (<1 ft) possible in upper Chesapeake Bay; significant surge (>3 ft) not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain Monday could total 1–2 inches locally, below major flood thresholds but enough for temporary drainage issues.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along Maryland and Delaware beaches; lowered ceilings and visibility may disrupt flight operations at nearby airports.
